latest_supported_binary.change_log:
v103:
- Pixel Ripped 1989 DLC purchase and game trailer available whithin 1995 main menu
- Main menu visual polishes (gearkid!)
- Fixed minor progression issue in Player Setup adding skip feature pressing A button
- Fixed minor system issue removing exit game option from main and pause menus

v106:
- Fixed the DLC achievements "Teacher's Pet" and "Teacher's Worse Nightmare";
- Fixed crashes on DLC levels 2 and 3, when Dot dies for the first time;
- Visual improvements on several DLC levels;
- Several DLC bug fixes.

v107:
- Fixed bug that made impossible to collect pixels at the table on final boss
- Fixed bug where VR future headset poster were stuck during level 1 boss fight

node.display_short_description: Play the VR classic that started the Pixel Ripped Series, NOW ON OCULUS QUEST in this FULL GAME DLC.Pixel Ripped 1989 is a multi-dimensional homage to the early days of gaming. Set in the era of portable 8-bit consoles, this game-within-a-game started the adventures of the videogame hero Dot. In 1989, the player inhabits Nicola, a second-grade student who must help Dot defeat the Cyblin Lord by facing 2D retro challenges while distracting the cranky teacher in her own 3D world.

nodes.title: Pixel Ripped 1989 is NOW AVAILABLE on the Quest as a Full Game DLC!
nodes.body_text:
We are SO EXCITED to have found a way to bring our VR classic to the
Oculus Quest so that more people can go back in time and enjoy the adventure that started it all!

About the game: Pixel Ripped 1989 is a wacky multi-dimensional homage to the early days of gaming. The player embarks on a journey into the screen of a classic videogame and beyond. Set in the era of portable 8-bit consoles, this game-within- a-game follows the adventures of Dot, an in-game character who sees her world torn apart by the Cyblin Lord, a villain able to break through the video game screen and invade the real world. In the game, the player inhabits Nicola, a second-grade student who must help Dot save both realities from this menace by facing challenges in the retro-gaming 2D world, all while distracting the cranky teacher and escaping from the furious headmaster in her own 3D world.

Download & Play Today!

nodes.title: Pixel Ripped 1995 just WON 'Best Sound Production' during the EVA Play 2020 Digital Awards! ğŸ†
nodes.body_text: BIG thanks to all of our players and fans who have continued to support us with this game! ğŸ¼ This is a great achievement for us all and we couldn't have done it without the help of Moon Sailor Music and Radio Ativa Pro! These talented people helped us create some insanely awesome retro vibes that fans will enjoy for years to come! ğŸ™Œ

node.reviewDescription:
I saw some of the negative reviews about this game.....one in particular about a player saying that this is nothing but old school gaming and that it is soooo bad they should be payed to play this......let me say......this game....the graphics, the gameplay and physics of this game are top notch excellent. You can tell this is a love letter to vr from devs that knew them some 90's games. It is absolutely amazing. One of the best games I have ever played .....Ever. This game sets the bar for current VR games on the quest.
Edit.....still a 5 star game because I feel like the pixel ripped series is fantastic but a note to devs that for some reason the pixel ripped 1989 dlc seems to be causing the game to crash quite frequently. I hope the devs see this and can patch....love the games though

developerResponse.body:
Hello friend! Thanks so much for your positive comments and amazing support! We noticed that you were having some troubles with the DLC causing crashes in your game and wanted to reach out and see if we could find out more information. Currently, we are still doing some optimizations with the DLC and plan to make some updates as soon as possible, still, we want to make sure that we don't miss anything important! 
If possible can you please join us on discord and so we can find out more about the crashes that you experienced? https://discord.com/invite/nxc348W

We do appreciate your time very much and we want to thank you again for playing our game!
